result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Darnell Pickens

defendant.name: Pickens, Ronald Darnell
defendant.address: 9415 W Silver Spring Dr Apt 2, Milwaukee, WI 53225

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald Darnell Pickens appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Ronald Darnell Pickens.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald Darnell Pickens appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Ronald Darnell Pickens.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: City of Milwaukee police officer Benjamin Haas. State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Supervision Report 9.1.22
Received and Signed. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Plummer, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.

Defendant Ronald Darnell Pickens in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary hearing adjourned for cause to Branch Br 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ronald Darnell Pickens
Current: 9415 W Silver Spring Dr Apt 2, Milwaukee, WI 53225 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2022)
Prior: 4428 North 58th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ronald Darnell Pickens in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Ronald Darnell Pickens in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ronald Darnell Pickens appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for Branch 29.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with FYE (5/9/75)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
